title: Metacognition as a precursor to self-consciousness: evolution, development and epistemology (MPSC)
abstractText: Metacognition, - i.e. thinking about thinking - may not be uniquely human, according to new experimental paradigms. This project critically examines the existence and nature of metacognitive abilities in non-human primates and develops comparative knowledge of metacognitive processes, by exploring how similar these capacities are in non-human animals, human children and human adults.
impactText: They might be useful for foundational work in the future.
findingsText: I have studied and developed logical norms on metacognition: how one ought to do rational cognition about rational cognition. Both philosophical and empirical work on metacognition can build on the foundational work that I have done. For instance, empirical work on metacognition needs normative benchmarks to be tested against--which is what my work supplied. Digital/Communication/Information Technologies (including Software)
